contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather. For that, let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, Seoul recorded its hottest day of the year yesterday and daytime temperatures today have risen making it feel like summer. What's in store for us for Children's Day tomorrow?

Well, Conn-young. Early summer-like weather has continued here today in South Korea, with highs above 25 degrees Celsius in most parts of the country and temperatures topping 30 degrees in Daegu. This weather anomaly comes as warm southwestern winds combined with heat energy has accumulated due to the recent dry weather. But temperatures are likely to return to normal levels and the heat is expected to be relieved for tomorrow.

There’ll be light showers on the East Coast starting from tonight. And tomorrow, it will be rainy starting from the afternoon, mainly in Chungcheong-do Province and some southern regions. Approximately 5 millimeters of rain are expected.

We're going to have to start off with cloudy skies tomorrow for Children's Day. Seoul will begin the day at 15 degrees, Daejeon and Daegu at 13 degrees.

Daytime highs will be lower than today's with 22 degrees in Seoul and 19 degrees in Busan.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will also see some light showers and Beijing will have sunny spells.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Summer-like heat nationwide, rain forecasteded for East Coast
Updated: 2020-05-04 17:05:49 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. We are seeing continued early summer-like temperatures today. Southern parts of the country, which saw some breezy weather on Sunday, will feel the warmth come back.

So, dry weather alerts have been lifted down south while a dry advisory remains in place for upper parts of the country. Good air quality nationwide.

It will be dry, sunny and warm up north, highs in the upper twenties, warmer in the Gyeongsang-do Provinces and surrounding regions under sunnier skies while Busan and Jeju will be relatively breezier at 24 and 22 degrees Celsius.

Children's Day, tomorrow is looking sunny and warm for most parts while southern parts of the country could see light showers from mid afternoon. Tuesday also marks Ipha, the beginning of summer according to seasonal customs and right on cue, we'll have early summer like weather for the rest of the week.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the globe.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

Unlike southern provinces where there was rain on Sunday, it remains dry for upper parts of the country with a dry weather advisory still in effect. Be careful with fire we are seeing more frequent reports of wildfire these days.

Taking a closer look at today's temperatures, lows are in the mid teens, under cloudy to mostly sunny skies, depending on where you are.

Highs will be in the upper twenties for most regions while Busan and Jeju will be relatively breezier at 24 and 22 degrees Celsius.

contents.headline:
Weather
Updated: 2020-05-03 10:46:21 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather. For that, let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, the first day of May got off to a nice warm start. We recorded the hottest temperatures of the year in Seoul today with highs reaching 28 degrees Celsius and Uljin in Gyeongsanbuk-do a whopping 30. What's in store for us over the weekend?

Well, Conn-young. Today's unseasonably warm weather was close to what we would get in mid-summer. Experts say, our bodies are not acclimated to the heat yet, especially after the lengthy string of cold snaps we were having. So, we should make sure not to catch a cold. Along with the heat, dry weather advisories have been placed in most parts of the country and a wind advisory has been issued in Gangwon-do Province.

The ridge of high pressure responsible for this early heat wave is crossing the Southwest, but will shift from tonight to Saturday. This will allow highs to drop to the mid-20s. Rain is forecasted for Gangwon-do Province and Jeju Island for the weekend, so please be prepared.

We'll have cloudy skies tomorrow in most parts of the nation with Seoul, Gwangju and Daegu all starting off at 17 degrees Celsius.

Daytime highs will be 23 degrees in Seoul. Gwangju and Jeju will see light rain showers in the afternoon.

Tokyo will see sunny spells and Beijing will experience extreme heat.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Summer-like heat for first day of May, dry weather advisories
Updated: 2020-05-01 17:14:25 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. It felt pretty warm this morning, starting in the mid to upper teens, but by the afternoon, most regions will see highs hitting the upper twenties to low thirties feeling more like early July rather than May under sunny skies.

The first day of May is kicking off with some summerlike heat for most region, while Busan will have seasonably warm temperatures at 22 degrees Celsius under mostly sunny skies and good air quality nationwide. Don't forget your sunscreen.

Note that a dry weather advisory remains in place for much of the country, be careful with fire and drink plenty of water to stay hydrated.

The sudden hot spell will be short-lived with rain in store for some parts of the country over the weekend. But Children's Day next Tuesday looks to be warm and sunny across the country. It also marks Ipha the beginning of summer, according to East Asian calendars.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the globe.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Summerlike heat, highs in 30s
Updated: 2020-05-01 06:04:44 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather. Let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, the warm weather is continuing and I hear we're going to experience some heat throughout the week. What's in store for us for the holiday tomorrow?

Well, Conn-young. It will be mostly sunny throughout the holiday period, which starts tomorrow. Daytime highs will hover around 22 to 25 degrees in the capital and Daegu. This warmness will continue until next Tuesday, which is Children's day.

But please keep in mind that that it will still be very dry. Dry weather warning for the southeast has been lifted, but advisories are still in place across most of the country. Please don't forget to take precautions against fires at all times.

We'll have sunny skies nationwide. Seoul will kick off at 10 degrees Celsius, Gwangju 9 and Daegu 10.

Daytime highs will be 24 degrees in Seoul and 27 degrees in Daegu, showing early summer-like weather.

Rain is expected in Gangwon-do province on Friday and Jeju on Saturday, so please be aware.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will see sunny spells and Beijing will experience extreme heat.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Clear skies but dry nationwide... early summer-like weather
Updated: 2020-04-29 17:03:21 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. We can surely tell that summer is just around the corner. UV rays will be very strong all day. Apply plenty of sunblock and wear sunglasses. Dry weather alerts also remain in place across much of the country.

Daily highs will be 1 to 3 degrees higher than yesterday, Seoul at 21 and Daegu at 25 degrees, Gyeongju at 26.

In fact, the warming trend will kick in over the next few days, Daegu will have a bit of a taste of summer, temperatures soaring to 30 degrees Celsius on Friday and Saturday. Seoul will also notice much warmer conditions.

Meanwhile rain is in store for parts of the east coast and Gangwon-do Province and southern regions for next four days. Be aware that Jeju will see rain on Saturday and Sunday. If you are planning to head to resort island. bring an umbrella

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
